ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Building with Visual Studio
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, the source tree structure was changed a while back, and the Visual Studio files weren t updated.  Since I no longer use a Windows PC, I don t have easy

Yes, the source tree structure was changed a while back, and the  
Visual Studio files weren't updated.  Since I no longer use a Windows  
PC, I don't have easy access to Visual Studio, and therefore its  
project files tend to lag behind the unix/mac Makefiles. I know there  
are some cross-platform build tools that can generate both unix/Mac  
Makefiles and Windows Visual Studio project files. One is CMake.   
I've played with it a little, and it seems promising. Anyone have  
experience with CMake?

Other than that, we'll need someone to volunteer to be the "Cantera  
Windos Guru", who will keep the Visual Studio files current, and  
handle Windows-related problems users have. Any volunteers?

Dave


On Jan 1, 2008, at 1:27 PM, yarmond wrote:

> I've been working on building Cantera using MS Visual Studio 2005 from
> the most recent CVS source, and it appears that the vcproj files in
> CVS are out of date. In addition to the issues with converting to the
> new compiler version (various spurious warnings), it seems like there
> has been a reorganization of the Cantera source files which required
> quite a few changes to the project files.
>
> I was able to get the Cantera to compile cleanly (apparently) with my
> modified project files, and I was wondering it would be useful for me
> to provide these files, or whether there are other plans to update the
> provided Visual Studio project files.
>
>
